WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine cocking your head to different angles and hearing cocks crow every time you do. Prison isn't as fun as you thought it would be. Manual labor and loud chickens aren't what you expected.

["Guangyun" Gu Yue cuts, enters consciousness, see. ]
(1) The hard bones that protrude from the top of the head or before the snout of beasts such as cattle, sheep, and deer. Generally slender and curved, the upper end is sharper, which has defensive and offensive functions.
(2) By referring to animals.
(3) The horns grow upright.
(4) Something shaped like an animal horn. The antennae of gastropods and other animals.
(5) Something shaped like an animal horn. The furry horns towering above the eagle's head.
(6) Something shaped like an animal horn. Horn-shaped plant fruit. Those with an elder shape are called "long horns"; those with a triangular or nearly spherical shape are called "short horns".
(7) Beak. The original word "Âô£".
(8) The frontal bone. Commonly known as the frontal angle.
(9) Hair accessories of underages in ancient times. The hair on both sides of the head is tied in a bun, shaped like a horn, so it is called.
(10) The place where the two edges of the object meet.
(11) Corner, corner.
(12) Extended to part.
(13) Headlands. A pointed land protruding into the sea. Mostly used for place names. For example, there is a town cape in Fujian Province. There is Chengshanjiao in Shandong Province.
(14) Said to open the two corners. Metaphorically attacking from both sides.
(15) It is called sticking to its angle. Metaphor face to face attack.
(16) A tool used to flatten Dendrobium when measuring grain in ancient times.
(17) Flat; make flat.
(18) Wrap, wrap.
(19) Oblique.
(20) Quantifiers. One cow weighs one horn.
(21) Quantifiers. Copies, seals.

Radicals: Âãπ, Áî®  (prison, task)
Meaning Mnemonic
Your task in prison is to bend things into different angles and then put them in the corner. No one will tell you why you're doing this, but you get a couple cents an hour to do it, so you aren't going to complain.
Picture yourself sitting in a corner, bending pieces of metal and scrap to fit the angle of that corner.
Reading Mnemonic
To get the angle right you find that you have to cock („Åã„Åè) your head to the side a lot. After cocking your head at weird angles so much you also start to hear cocks crowing in your head. Cock-co-cock-co-caww!
Imagine cocking your head to different angles and hearing cocks crow every time you do. Prison isn't as fun as you thought it would be. Manual labor and loud chickens aren't what you expected.
